subject: Science
title: Comets: Dirty Snowballs
description: A 60-second lesson on Comets: Dirty Snowballs.

hook.text: Comets have terrified humans for millennia. People thought they were omens of doom.

buildup.text: They're actually chunks of ice, dust, and rock left over from the solar system's birth.

discovery.text: When a comet nears the Sun, ice vaporizes and creates a glowing tail millions of km long.

twist.text: The tail always points away from the Sun, pushed by solar wind â€” not trailing behind.

climax.text: Some comets return regularly. Halley's Comet visits every 75 years.

punchline.text: A comet's tail doesn't trail it. The Sun decides the direction.

quiz.question: What determines the direction of a comet's tail?
options: Solar wind pushes it away from the Sun
